2) When performing a [CLOAK] Action from your Action Bar, place your [CLOAK] Token beside your ship instead of on your ship's base. That ship cannot be target locked that round.
OR
3) When performing a [SENSOR ECHO] Action from your Action Bar, you may use a 1 [FORWARD], 2 [FORWARD], or a 3 [FORWARD] Maneuver Template.

Resource.Title: Advanced Technology
Resource.Ability:
During the Activation Phase, any ship in your fleet may:
1) Disable one of its [TECH] Upgrades to use an Action from its Action Bar as a free Action.
OR
2) Discard one of its already disabled [TECH] Upgrades to use an Action from its Action Bar as a free Action.
A ship cannot perform any other free Actions on the round that it uses either of these abilities.

Resource.Title: Main Power Grid
Resource.Ability:
This resource costs 3 SP plus 2 SP for each Hull value greater than 3.
Once per round, one of your ships may use one of the following abilities:
1) When attacking with your Primary Weapon, during the Roll Attack Dice step, suffer 1 damage to your Hull and disable all of your remaining Shields to roll +2 attack dice that round.
OR
2) When defending, during the Compare Results step, cancel up to 2 of the attacking ship's attack dice and place an Auxiliary Power Token beside your ship. Your ship cannot attack during the round you use this ability.

Resource.Title: Tactics
Resource.Ability:
At the start of the battle, place 2 [EVADE] Tokens, 2 [SCAN] Tokens and 2 [BATTLE STATIONS] Tokens on top of this card.
Each round, during the Activation Phase, one ship in your fleet may choose one of the Tokens from on top of this card and place it beside its ship. Treat this as if that ship performed an free Action of the appropriate type.
If the ship performing this Action does not have the Action listed on its Action Bar, it may still perform the Action, but it is considered a Standard Action instead of a free Action. In addition, place an Auxiliary Power Token beside that ship.

Resource.Title: Structural Damage Check
Resource.Ability:
At the start of the game, place 5 Auxiliary Power Tokens on this card.
At the end of each Activation Phase, after every ship has moved, you may choose to remove 1 Auxiliary Power Token from this card and place it beside one ship in your fleet. If you do this:
1) Repair 1 damage to that ship's Hull
OR
2) Flip 1 Critical Damage Card that is assigned to that ship face down.
Remove this card from the game when there are no Auxiliary Power Tokens left on this card.

Resource.Title: General Orders
Resource.Ability:
At the start of the game, place 5 [BATTLE STATIONS] Tokens on this card.
During the Activation Phase, if a ship in your fleet is within Range 1-3 and in the firing arc (forward or rear) of an opposing ship after the opposing ship ends its move, you may choose to immediately remove 1 [BATTLE STATIONS] Token from this card and place it beside your ship, even if there is already a [BATTLE STATIONS] Token beside that ship.
Remove this card from the game when there are no [BATTLE STATIONS] Tokens left on this card.

Resource.Title: Emergency Power
Resource.Ability:
At the start of the game, place 5 Mission Tokens on this card.
During the Execute Maneuver step of the Activation Phase, after a ship in your fleet performs a green or white maneuver, that ship may immediately perform an additional maneuver with a speed of 1 or 2. Treat this additional maneuver as a red maneuver.
You may only use this ability once per round and each time you do this, remove 1 Mission Token from this card from the game.
Remove this card from the game when there are no Mission Tokens left on this card.

Resource.Title: Improved Hull
Resource.Ability:
At the start of the game, place 1 Mission Token on any or all of your Ship Cards in your Fleet.
For the remainder of the game, the Hull Value of each ship with a Mission Token on its Ship Card is considered to be +1.
The cost of this resource is a number of SP equal to the total combined starting Hull Values of all of the ships in your fleet divided by 2 (round up). For example, if your fleet has a total combined Hull Value of 15, the cost of this resource would be 8.

Resource.Title: Intercepted Messages
Resource.Ability:
At the start of the game, place 5 [EVADE] Tokens on this card.
During the Activation Phase, if an opposing ship that is within Range 1-2 of one of your ships performs a [SCAN], [BATTLE STATIONS], [TARGET LOCK], or [CLOAK] Action from its Action Bar, you may choose to immediately remove 1 [EVADE] Token from this card and place it beside your ship, even if there is already one there. You may only use this ability once per round.
Remove this card from the game when there are no [EVADE] Tokens left on this card.

Resource.Title: Condition Alert
Resource.Ability:
At the start of the game, place 6 Mission Tokens on this card.
During the End Phase, if a ship in your fleet has exactly 1 unused Token beside it ([EVADE] or [BATTLE STATIONS]), you may remove 1 Mission Token from this card to leave that Token beside the ship instead of removing it.
You may only use this ability once per round.
Remove this card from the game when there are no Mission Tokens left on this card.

Resource.Title: Scan Cycle
Resource.Ability:
At the start of the game, place 5 [SCAN] Tokens on this card.
During the Activation Phase, when a ship in your fleet performs an Action from its Action Bar, you may remove 1 [SCAN] Token from this card and place it beside the ship as a free Action.
NOTE: You may place the free [SCAN] Token even if there is already a [SCAN] Token beside the ship. You may only use this ability once per round.
Remove this card from the game when there are no [SCAN] Tokens left on this card.

Resource.Title: Fleet Commander
Resource.Ability:
One ship in your fleet may have a 2nd Captain assigned to it. That ship may use both of its Captains' abilities as normal throughout the game.
The overall Captain Skill Number for the ship is equal to the highst Captain Skill of its two Captains plus 1.
In addition, the ship to which the 2nd Captain is assigned gains +1 to either its Shield or Hull value (max 6 Hull). This decision must be made at the start of the game during the Gather Forces step and cannot be changed for the remainder of the game.

Resource.Title: Auxiliary Power
Resource.Ability:
At the start of the game place 5 Auxiliary Power Tokens on top of this card.
Once per round, one ship in your fleet may use one of the following abilities:
1) Add 1 extra attack or defense die. OR
2) Place 1 Evade Token beside your ship (even if there is one already there). OR
3) Repair 1 Shield Token.
If you use one fo these abilities, remove one Auxiliary Power Token from this card and place it beside the ship that used the ability.
Discard this card when there are no more Auxiliary Power Tokens on this card.

Resource.Title: All Stop
Resource.Ability:
At the start of the game, place 5 Mission Tokens on this card.
Each round, during the Activation Phase, one ship in your fleet may disregard its chosen maneuver and not move A ship that uses this ability must skip its Perform Action step.
If you use this ability, remove one Mission Token from this card and place it back in the supply.
Discard this card when there are no more Mission Tokens on this card.

Resource.Title: Senior Staff
Resource.Ability:
Each ship in your fleet my field 1 additional [ELITE TALENT] Upgrade for every [CREW] Upgrade assigned to it. Each [ELITE TALENT] Upgrade is placed next to the [CREW] Upgrade that fielded it.
If the [CREW] Upgrade is ever discarded, you must also discard the [ELITE TALENT] Upgrade that was fielded by that [CREW] Upgrade.
The cost of this resource is 1 SP for each additional [ELITE TALENT] Upgrade you assign to your fleet.

Resource.Title: Senior Staff
Resource.Ability:
At the start of the game, place 3 Mission Tokens on this card.
Once per round, during an opposing ship's Perform Action step, if that ship chooses to perform an Action from its Action Bar, you may remove 1 Mission Token from this card to prevent that ship from performing that Action.
NOTE: This ability occurs after the Action is announced, but before the Action is performed and the opposing ship cannot perform any additional Action(s) during the round in which you use this ability.
Remove this card from the game when there are no Mission Tokens left on this card.

Resource.Title: Co-Pilot
Resource.Ability:
At the start of the game, place 5 Mission Tokens on this card.
Once per round, during the Combat Phase, you may remove one Mission Token from this card to use one of the following abilities for one of your ships:
1) Add +3 to your Captain Skill Number. 2) Re-roll one of your attack or defense dice. OR
3) Place an [EVADE] or a [BATTLE STATIONS] Token beside your ship.
Remove this card from the game when there are no Mission Tokens left on this card.

Resource.Title: Captain's Chair
Resource.Ability: This card can only be assigned to a ship that has a Captain with a printed Captain Skill of 5 or higher. ACTIVATION PHASE: Once per game round, after this ship executes a Non-Red Maneuver: Remove a [DISABLED] Token from 1 of the cards equipped to this ship.

Resource.Title: Front-Line Retrofit
Resource.Ability:
This card can only be assigned to a ship that has a printed Hull Value of 3 or less.
This ship gains the following:
1) Increase this ship's Shield Value by +1.
2) Add an additional [TECH] to this ship's Upgrade Bar.
3) Increase the Captain Skill of the Captain assigned to this ship by +1.

Flagship.Title: Romulan
Flagship.Ability: When attacking, all other friendly, Romulan ships within Range 1-2 of your Flagship may choose any number of their attack dice and re-roll them once.

Flagship.Title: Independent (Romulan)
Flagship.Ability: When defending, all other friendly ships within Range 1 of your Flagship gain +1 defense die.

Flagship.Title: Klingon
Flagship.Ability: When attacking, all other friendly Klingon ships within Range 1-2 of your Flagship may convert 1 blank result into 1 [HIT] result.

Flagship.Title: Independent (Klingon)
Flagship.Ability: All other friendly ships within Range 1 of your Flagship gain +1 attack die when attacking at Range 2-3.

Flagship.Title: Dominion
Flagship.Ability: When defending, all other friendly Dominion ships within Range 1-2 of your Flagship may convert 1 blank result into 1 [EVASION] result.

Flagship.Title: Independent (Dominion)
Flagship.Ability: After your Flagship moves, you may target 1 other Friendly ship within Range 1 of your Flagship. Target ship immediately performs an extra white or green Maneuver.

Flagship.Title: Federation
Flagship.Ability: When defending, all other friendly Federation ships within Range 1-2 of your Flagship may choose any number of their defense dice and re-roll them once.

Flagship.Title: Independent (Federation)
Flagship.Ability: After your Flagship moves, you may target 1 other Friendly ship within Range 1 of your Flagship. Target ship immediately performs a 2nd Action listed on its Action Bar as a free Action this round.

FleetCaptain.Title: Federation
FleetCaptain.Ability: After you move, you may target 1 friendly Federation ship within Range 1-3 (or your own ship). The target ship immediately removes 1 Disabled Upgrade Token from 1 of its disabled Upgrades as a free Action.

FleetCaptain.Title: Dominion
FleetCaptain.Ability: After you move, you may target 1 friendly Dominion ship within Range 1-2 (or your own ship). The target ship immediately performs an Action on one of its non-disabled [TECH] Upgrades as a free Action.

FleetCaptain.Title: Romulan
FleetCaptain.Ability: After you move, you may target 1 friendly Cloaked Romulan ship within Range 1-2 (or your own ship). The target ship immediately performs a [SENSOR ECHO] Action as a free Action.

FleetCaptain.Title: Klingon
FleetCaptain.Ability: After you move, you may target 1 friendly Klingon ship within Range 1-2 (or your own ship). The target ship immediately performs an action on one of its non-disabled [CREW] Upgrades as a free Action.

FleetCaptain.Title: Independent (Klingon)
FleetCaptain.Ability: All of your [CREW] Upgrades cost -1 SP for all ships in your fleet (including your own ship).

FleetCaptain.Title: Independent (Federation)
FleetCaptain.Ability: After you move, you may target 1 friendly ship within Range 1-2 (or your own ship). The target ship immediately performs an additional white "1" Maneuver (forward, bank or turn).

FleetCaptain.Title: Independent (Romulan)
FleetCaptain.Ability: All your [WEAPON] Upgrades cost -1 SP for all ships in your fleet (including your own ship).

FleetCaptain.Title: Independent (Dominion)
FleetCaptain.Ability: All of your [TECH] Upgrades cost -1 SP for all ships in your fleet (including your own ship).

Officer.Title: First Officer
Officer.Ability: Whenever you perform a [BATTLESTATIONS], [SCAN], or [EVASIVE] Action, you may place 2 Tokens of the appropriate type beside your ship instead of 1. If you do so, place an Auxiliary Power Token beside your ship. If your Captain's Skill is ever reduced below 4, you may use the Skill Number on this card instead of your Captain's Skill Number.

Officer.Title: Tactical Officer
Officer.Ability: Add 1 [WEAPON] Upgrade slot to your Upgrade Bar. During the Roll Attack Dice step of the Combat Phase, you may spend a [BATTLESTATIONS] Token to roll +1 attack die. During the Roll Defense Dice step of the Combat Phase, you may spend a [BATTLESTATIONS] Token to roll +1 defense die.

Officer.Title: Operations Officer
Officer.Ability: Add 1 [CREW] Upgrade slot to your Upgrade Bar. During the Modify Attack Dice step of the Combat Phase, you may choose one of your attack dice and re-roll that die twice. During the Modify Defense Dice step of the Combat Phase, you may choose one of your defense dice and re-roll that die twice.

Officer.Title: Science Officer
Officer.Ability: Add 1 [TECH] Upgrade slot to your Upgrade Bar. Each time you attack, if there is a [SCAN] Token beside your ship, the defender rolls -2 defense dice instead of -1. During the Modify Defense Dice step of the Combat Phase, you may spend a [SCAN] Token to add 1 [EVASIVE] result to your roll.

Reference.Title: Energy Dampening Token (EDT)
Reference.Ability:
As soon as the ship receives the EDT, disable all of its remaining Shields and remove its [CLOAK] Token, if any. While the ship has the EDT, it cannot attack or raise its Shields.
During the Planning Phase the owner does not assign a maneuver dial to this ship.
During the Activation Phase the owner moves the ship as if it were assigned a White 1 [STRAIGHT] Maneuver. After executing this Maneuver, remove all EDTs from this ship It may now perform Actions and attack as normal.

Reference.Title: Tribble Token
Reference.Ability:
During the End Phase add 1 Tribble Token to your Ship Card (regardless of the number of Tribble Tokens it already has).
If your ship has 1-3 Tribble Tokens, add +1 attack die whenever you attack and +1 defense die whenever you defend. Ignore this rule if your ship includes any Klingon Captains or Crew
If your Ship has 4-5 Tribble Tokens, there is no effect. If your ship has 6 or more Tribble Tokens, roll 1 less attack die whenever you attack and 1 less defense die whenever you defend. This penalty is doubled if your ship includes any Klingon Captains or Klingon Crew.
Your ship gains the following Action:
Action: If your ship is not Cloaked, disable all of your remaining Shields and target a ship at range 1-2 that is not Cloaked and has no Active Shields. Place any number of your Tribble Tokens beside the target ship's Ship Card. You cannot transfer any Tribble Token that you received this round.

Reference.Title: Muon Token
Reference.Ability:
A Muon Token stays with a ship until it is removed. During the Activation Phase after the ship moves, the ship takes damage to its Hull equal to the number of its current Maneuver -1. The type of maneuver does not matter, just the number.
After the ship performs a Green or White Maneuver, it can spend an Action to remove the Muon Token.

Reference.Title: United Force
Reference.Ability:
You may only deploy this Order if your Captain and all Upgrades on each of your ships match the same Faction as the ship itself.
While the United Force Order is a part of your fleet:
1) During Set Up, you may spend an additional 10 SP on Upgrades, as long as each Upgrade is deployed to a ship of its own Faction. You cannot change these upgrades between Battle Rounds of a tournament.
2) Once per round, you may re-roll any one of your dice (even if it has already been re-rolled).
3) You cannot place a Captain or Upgrade from the Reinforcements Sideboard onto a ship of a different Faction.

Reference.Title: Strike Force
Reference.Ability:
You may only deploy this Order if your Fleet includes exactly 2 Ships.
While the Strike Force Order is a part of your fleet:
1) Once during each Activation Phase, one of your ships may perfor one Action on its Action Bar as a free Action.
2) Once during each Combat Phase, one of you non-Cloaked Ships may roll 1 extra attack die OR 1 extra defense die. You must add the extra die before rolling your other dice during that attack or defense.

Reference.Title: Adaptation Token
Reference.Ability:
1) While an Adaptation Token is on a [TECH] Upgrade, Seven of Nine's ship is now considered to also possess that [TECH] Upgrade (even if Seven is disabled). The original Upgrade Card is unaffected and can be used freely by its owner. If the original Upgrade is disabled or discarded, Seven's ship is still considered to possess that [TECH] Upgrade and can freely use it.
2) If using the [TECH] Upgrade would normally require the Upgrade to be disabled or discarded, then when Seven's ship uses the Upgrade, remove the Adaptation Token. The Original Upgrade is unaffected.
3) Only 1 Adaptation Token may be in play at the same time. If Seven of Nine uses her ability on another [TECH] Upgrade, remove the Adaptation Token from the previous Upgrade.
4) If Seven of Nine is discarded, discard the Adaptation Token.

Reference.Title: Ablative Generator Token (AGT)
Reference.Ability:
A ship with an AGT assigned to it follows these special rules:
1) As soon as the ship receives the AGT, disable all of its remaining Shields and remove its [CLOAK] token, if any.
2) While the ship has the AGT, it cannot raise its Shields or Cloak
3) Convert all [CRIT] results against the ship to [HIT] results
4) Place all damage Cards that the ship receives beneath the Ablative Generator Upgrade Card. If the player removes the AGT from beside the ship, the Damage Cards remain beneath the Ablative Generator card.
5) Once the Ablative Generator receives 5 Damage Cards, discard the Upgrade Card (and all 5 Damage Cards), and then remove the AGT from beside the ship. All excess damage affects the ship as normal.

Reference.Title: Borg Tractor Beam Token
Reference.Ability:
A ship with a white BTBT assigned to it follows these special rules.
1) As soon as the ship receives the BTBT, disable 2 of that ship's Active Shields (if the ship was cloaked, remove the [CLOAK] Token and raise all of its Shields except 2).
2) While the ship has the BTBT, it cannot raise its Shields or Cloak.
3)During the Planning Phase, the owner may not select a Maneuver whose number is greater than 2.
4) At the end of the Activation Phase, if the ship is no longer within Range 1 of the ship with the corresponding BTBT (the one that matches the white token's letter), remove the BTBTs from both ships.

Reference.Title: Drone Tokens
Reference.Ability:
Each Drone Token has a Drone number listed on the face, as well as a Captain Skill Number listed on the back. The Drone Tokens are placed in a stack on top of the Captain Card in descending order (from highest to lowest) of their Drone numbers.
NOTE: The Drone number listed on the token at the top of the stack is always considered the ship's current Captain Skill. At the start of the game, place the Drone Token that has the starting Captain Skill beside the ship (this will be the reverse side of the token that reads "START" on the face).
When a Drone Token is used, remove one Token from the top of the stack and flip it over. Then remove the Drone Token that is beside the ship from play and replace it with the token that you just removed from the stack.
NOTE: The Captain Skill that is listed on the Token beside the ship should always be equal to the number of Drone Tokens left on the Captain Card.

Reference.Title: Regenerate
Reference.Ability:
Ships with the [REGENERATE] icon in their Action Bar may perform the REGENERATE Action.
A Ship the performs the [REGENERATE] Action immediately repairs 1 damage of its choice to its Hull (critical or normal).
A ship cannot attack during the round that it performs the [REGENERATE] Action.

Reference.Title: Spin Maneuver
Reference.Ability:
The Spin Maneuver [LEFT SPIN] or [RIGHT SPIN] uses the same movement template as a Straight Maneuver [STRAIGHT].
However, before executing a Spin Maneuver, the player rotates their ship 90. In order to rotate a ship, place a [1 STRAIGHT] Maneuver Template touching the side of the ship's base with the top edge of the template even with the front eedge of the ship base (as shown in A below).
Then, rotate the ship 90 (either right or left depending on the selected maneuver) so that the top edge of the [1 STRAIGHT] maneuver template is even with the side of the ship base (as shown in B below).
After rotating the ship, complete the selected maneuver as normal using the appropriate maneuver template.

Reference.Title: Initiative
Reference.Ability:
Ships have initiative, a distinction used to resolve timing conflicts involving Captains of equal Skill. The ships belonging to the player with the LOWEST point total at the start of the game always have initiative. The next lowest point total have initiative, and so on. If two or more players' squadron point totals are equal at the start of the game, then use the ship's Faction to determine the order of initiative as follows:
Q Continuum Federation Klingon Romulan Dominion Borg Species 8472 Kazon Xindi Bajoran Ferengi Vulcan Independent Mirror Universe
Initiative does not change during the game. During the Activation Phase, when ships of equal Captain Skill are activated, the ship with initiative activates first. Then the next ship in initiative order that has the same Captain Skill activates, and so on.
Initiative also applies during the Combat Phase; the ship with initiative resolves its combat steps BEFORE an opponent's ship with the same Captain Skill (see "Simultaneous Attack Rule").
If a single place owns multiple ships from the same Faction with the same Captain Skill, he may activate those ships and resolve their attacks in the order of his choosing.
It may be possible for different players to have ships from the same Faction with the same Captain Skill. When this occurs, determine randomly at the start of the game which of those ships will have initiative over the others throughout the game.

Reference.Title: Nebula
Reference.Ability:
Ships may only fire up to Range 3 with their forward firing arcs and ships defending at Range 3 receive an additional Defense Die.
All other attacks, are limited to a maximum of up to Range 2.
Ships without a forward firing arc have a maximum of up to Range 2.

Reference.Title: Energy Flux
Reference.Ability:
After targeting an opposing ship with an attack but before making the attack roll, roll an Attack die that cannot be re-rolled.
On a result of a [BATTLE STATIONS], reduce the attacking ship's printed Primary Weapon value by half (rounding up).
Further modifications to the Attack roll from game effects may be applied after the Energy Flux die roll as normal.

Reference.Title: Meteor Shower
Reference.Ability:
At the start of the Planning Phase, roll one Attack die per ship in turn that cannot be re-rolled and resolve effect before rolling for next ship.
Any [HIT] or [CRITICAL] damages the target ship as normal.
Ships may roll defense dice against this damage using their ship's printed Agility value.

Reference.Title: Energy Web Token (EWT)
Reference.Ability:
The EWTs are double-sided, with a gold border on one side. If both fleets are using EWTs, one fleet places the gold border side face up and the other fleet places the non-gold border side face up.
Once you place an EWT in the play area, it will remain there until the end of the battle unless your last Tholian ship is destroyed, in which case all of your EWTs are immediately removed from the play area.
GUIDE TOKENS Guide Tokens are used to place new EWTs in the play area. A Guide Token will remain adjacent to the rear of a Tholian Ship for one full turn after performing an Energy Web Action, including during movement. If the Tholian Ship does not perform an Energy Web Action on the following turn, then the Guide Token is removed from beside the ship. While the Guide Token is adjacent to a Tholian Ship, it is considered an EWT for purposes of damaging and obstructing enemy ships (see below).
ENERGY WEB EWTs are treated as Obstacles but do not inflict normal Obstacle damage.
A ship whose base or Maneuver Template overlaps an EWT, or a ship that has an EWT placed on top of it, must roll 1 attack die for every 2 EWTs in that you have in the play area, rounded up (max 10 dice.). Any [HIT] or [CRIT] damages the target ship as normal. The affected ship does not roll any defense dice.
NOTE: Tholian ships are immune to the effects of EWTs and may move and/or fire through them without penalty.
To place an EWT after performing an Energy Web Action, follow these steps:
1) After performing a 1 [STRAIGHT] Maneuver, place a Guide Token (or slide an existing Guide Token Forward) so that the side of the Guide Token with the arrow pointing toward it touches and lines up with the back edge of your ship's base.
2) Place an EWT so that the end of the EWT touches the back of the Guide Token and lines up with the beam line on the Guide Token.
3) After you place the EWT, you may change the facing of your ship. If you choose to do so, place a 2nd Guide Token (be sure that the arrow is pointing away from the EWT). NOTE: When changing your facing, you may place the 2nd Guide Token to the right or left of the existing Guide Token.
4) Move your ship so that the back edge of the ship's base touches and lines up with the edge of the new Guide Token. Then remove the first Guide Token.

Reference.Title: Grapple Token
Reference.Ability:
Each ship cable of performing the Grappler Action can maintain only 1 Grapple at a time (i.e. Each ship can only have 1 blue Grapple Token assigned to it.) While a ship has a Red Grapple Token assigned to it, that ship follows these special rules:
1) When attacking, the ship rolls 1 less attack dice. Each time the ship defends, it rolls 1 less defense die.
2) During the Planning Phase, the ship's owner cannot select a Speed greater then 2.
3) At the end of the Activation Phase, if the grappled ship is no longer within Range 1 of the grappling ship, then remove the corresponding Red and Blue Grapple tokens from beside both ships.
4) During the Combat Phase, a grappled ship may forego its attack, and roll a number of attack dice equal to its Primary Weapon Value. If that ship rolls at least 2 [HIT] or [CRIT] results, remove the corresponding Red and Blue Grapple Tokens from beside both ships. This roll cannot be modified.

Reference.Title: Borg Shield Matrix Token (BSMT)
Reference.Ability:
A ship with at least 1 BSMT on its Borg Shield Matrix upgrade gfollows these Special rules:
1) Each time you defend, roll +1 defense die for every BSMT on your Borg Shield Matrix Upgrade (+3 dice max).
2) Whenever an enemy ship attempts to affect your Captain or 1 of your Upgrades, roll 1 attack die for each BSMT on your Borg Shield Matrix Upgrade. If you roll at least 1 [HIT] or [CRIT] result, the attempt fails and your Captain or Upgrade is unaffected. Note: If the attempt required 1 or more of the initiating ship's cards to be disabled or discarded in order to make the attempt, those cards are still disabled or discarded, even if the attempt failed.
If your Borg Shield Matrix Upgrade is disabled, you do not gain the above special abilities. If you Borg Shield Matrix Upgrade is discarded, discard all the BSMT on it as well. Borg Shiel Matrix Tokens cannot otherwise be removed from your Borg Shield Matrix Upgrade Card once they are placed.

Reference.Title: Escape Pod Token (EPT)
Reference.Ability:
While an Escape Pod Token is in the play area:
1) During the Activation Phase, after all ships have moved, the Escape Pod must move 1 [FORWARD] in the direction of the arrow on the Token. If it overlaps a friendly ship's base after this move, it is considered to be picked up by the ship (see below). If it overlaps an enemy ship's base after its move, it is destroyed.
2) During the Combat Phase, it cannot attack, but it may be attacked. It has 0 Agility, a Hull Value of 1, and 0 Shields.
3) The cards beneath the "Escape Pod" Upgrade card cannot use their text abilities and cannot be affected by enemy Upgrades.
If a friendly ship is within Range 1 of an EPT at the end of the Activation Phase (or it is placed directly on a friendly ship's base), the EPT is considered picked up. Remove the EPT from the game and discard the "Escape Pod" Upgrade Card. Place all of the cards beneath it beside that ship's cards. These cards are now considered to be deployed to that ship.
NOTE: The [CREW] Upgrade cards may exceed the ship's restrictions, but there may only be 1 Captain Card assigned to the ship. You may keep either your original Captain card or the one from the Escape Pod and remove the other one from the game.

Reference.Title: Time Token
Reference.Ability:
Many Upgrades instruct a player to place a certain number of Time Tokens on them. The player places that many Time Tokens on the Upgrade and cannot activate that Upgrade again until after all of its Time Tokens have expired. During the End Phase, the player removes 1 Time Token from each of his Upgrades.
For example, a ship that uses a Photon Torpedoes Upgrade places 3 Time Tokens on it. This means that the ship will not be able to initiate that attack until after all of the Time Tokens have been removed.

Reference.Title: Continuous Effect Token (CET)
Reference.Ability:
Many Upgrades feature Continuous Effects, which are tracked through the use of Continuous Effect Tokens (CETs). CETs bear the same name as their corresponding Upgrade Cards (on the back). Some Continuous Effects are beneficial (featuring a green bordered CET) and others are detrimental (featuring a red bordered CET).
During Set-Up, players place all of their Upgrades' CETs on top of their corresponding Upgrade Cards so that they are always near at hand. When a Continuous Effect is activated, the corresponding CET(s) are placed in the play area beside the Effect's recipient(s).
Whenever an Upgrade with a Continuous Effect instructs a player to place Time Tokens on it, the Continuous Effect begins. If the Upgrade does not specify the recipient of the Continuous Effect, then the Continuous Effect affects the owner.
During the End Phase (or at any other time), if an Upgrade loses its last Time Token, the Continuous Effect ends and the corresponding CET(s) are removed from the play area and placed back on top of their corresponding Upgrade Card.
If a CET is ever removed from the play area prematurely due to a special ability, then the Effect ends immediately and the CET is returned to its Upgrade Card. Any remaining Time Tokens stay on the Upgrade Card, however, prohibiting the ship from activating the Upgrade again until after the Time Tokens expire.
SPECIAL RULE FOR CONTINUOUS EFFECTS: If an upgrade with Time Tokens is disabled or discarded, then its Time Tokens remain on the card and any of its Continuous Effects that were already active remain in effect until the duration expires. This also applies to Upgrades belonging to a destroyed ship.
PERMANENT EFFECT TOKEN: Some Upgrades instruct a player to place a Permanent Effect Token on them. A Permanent Effect Token has a purple border and is not removed during the End Phase.

Reference.Title: Shuttlecrafts
Reference.Ability:
Shuttlecrafts are treated as normal ships with the following exceptions.
1) Shuttlecrafts can only attack enemy ships at Range 1-2.
2) A shuttlecraft is either considered "Active" (in the play area) or "Inactive" (docked on another ship).
3) If, through the use of an ability, you are able to deploy a [WEAPON] Upgrade to a shuttlecraft, you cannot deploy a [WEAPON] Upgrade to that shuttlecraft with a cost of more than 3 SP (with the exception of the Antimatter Mines Upgrade).
4) For each Shuttlecraft assigned to your fleet there must be 1 ship with a hull value of 4 or more (referred to as a "Capital Ship").
DOCKING A SHUTTLECRAFT: During the Activation Phase, a player may use the following Action to dock his shuttlecraft on another ship with a Hull Value of 4 or more:
ACTION: Place the Captain and all of the Upgrades assigned to the shuttlecraft beneath the shuttlecraft's Ship Card and place them beside the docking ship's cards. Then remove your shuttlecraft from the play area and place it on top of its Ship Card. All of the tokens that were beside the shuttlecraft are place back in the supply. Place an Auxiliary Power Token beside the docking ship.
NOTE: A player may only use the docking Action if after his shuttlecraft moves, its base overlaps a friendly ship's base, OR if after one of his ships moves, that ship's base overlaps a friendly shuttlecraft's base. Otherwise, if a shuttlecraft's base overlaps or is overlapped by another ship's base, the shuttlecraft suffers 1 damage in addition to the normal overlap rules (see pg. 18).
While a shuttlecraft is docked on another ship it is considered to be "Inactive" and the following applies to it:
a) None of its cards (Ship, Captain, Admiral or Upgrades) can be used for their text abilities or affected by an enemy ship. NOTE: These cards are considered to be out of play and are not considered to be deployed to the docking ship.
b) The shuttlecraft is destroyed if the docking ship is destroyed.
c) You may exchange cards from the shuttlecraft to the docking ship and vice versa by spending the docking ship's Action to perform the following Action:
ACTION: Remove a Captain and/or any number of Upgrades from beneath your shuttlecraft's Ship Card and assign them to the docking ship. Then remove a Captain and/or any number of Upgrades from the docking ship and place them beneath your shuttlecraft's Ship Card. Both ship's [sic] must still have a Captain and all Upgrade restrictions still apply.
NOTE: You cannot switch cards that have an extra cost or can only be deployed to a specific ship or type of ship by using this Action.
LAUNCHING A SHUTTLECRAFT: During the Planning Phase, a player may launch a shuttlecraft from the docking ship's Ship Card and places [sic] it in the play area within Range 1 of the Docking ship. Then he separates the shuttlecraft's cards from the docking ship's cards, takes them out from beneath the shuttlecraft's Ship Card and places an Auxiliary Power Token beside both ships. He then chooses a Maneuver for his Active shuttlecraft. NOTE: A Shuttlecraft cannot be placed on top of another ship's base when launching.
